title: Minimum Operations
problem_statement:
Minimum Operations

Max. score: 100.00

Ben has been asked Q queries. Each query consists of two integers L and R. He wrote all the numbers from L to R (both inclusive) on the paper. In one operation, he can remove two integers a and b from the paper and instead insert a/4 (rounding off to the nearest integer) and b/4. For each query, he is asked to find the minimum number of operations to make all the integers equal to 0.

Function Description

Complete the solve() function. The function takes the following two parameters and returns an array:

  • Q: Represents the total number of queries.
  • Queries: Represents Q arrays. Each array contains two integers, L and R.

Input Format for Custom Testing

Note: Use this input format if you are testing against custom input or writing code in a language where we don\'t provide boilerplate code.

  • The first line contains an integer Q denoting the size of array queries.
  • The next Q lines contain two integers, L and R.

Output Format

Print Q space-separated integers representing the answer.

Constraints

  • 1 ≤ Q ≤ 106
  • 1 ≤ L ≤ R ≤ 106

Sample Test Case

Input:
2
1 2
2 4
Output:
3 5

Explanation

Given:

  • Q=2
  • Queries = [[1, 2], [2, 4]]

Approach:

  • For query 1, [1, 2] → [4, 0] → [1, 0] → [0, 0], Minimum operation = 3
  • For query 2, [2, 3, 4] → [2, 0, 16] → [0, 0, 16] → [0, 0, 4] → [0, 0, 1] → [0, 0, 0], Minimum operation = 5
